data.title: Reginald T. Gwinn
data.meta_description: TAYLORS -- Reginald Thomas Gwinn, 49, of 201 Bulls Road died May 26, 2003, at Greenville Memorial Hospital. \n A native of Greenville County, he was the son of Thomas Judson and Mary Bull Gwinn of Tayâ€¦
data.text:
TAYLORS -- Reginald Thomas Gwinn, 49, of 201 Bulls Road died May 26, 2003, at Greenville Memorial Hospital.

A native of Greenville County, he was the son of Thomas Judson and Mary Bull Gwinn of Taylors.

He was the plant engineer at Faith Printing Company, where he worked for 30 years. He was a member of Double Springs Baptist Church.

Surviving in addition to his parents are a brother, Barry Gwinn of Marietta; a sister, Kimberly Neves of Travelers Rest; and several nieces and one nephew.

Visitation will be from 2:30 to 4 p.m. today at Double Springs Baptist Church.

Funeral services will follow at 4 p.m. at the church, conducted by the Rev. Wayne Jones and Dr. James Thompson. Burial will follow in the church cemetery.

The family is at the home of his parents, 210 Bulls Road, Taylors.

Memorials may be made to WGGS TV, P.O. Box 1616, Greenville, SC, 29602; or to Double Springs Baptist Church Building Fund, 3800 Locust Hill Road, Taylors, SC, 29687.

The Wood Mortuary is in charge of arrangements.
